data.text: Finally, the rise we started to see in younger ages has continued, which again still smells to me like schools - but also seeing rise in 0-9, so it may be more K-12 where the increase really is. This needs a little more digging into in future days. https://t.co/LxfWTJ3AwZ

Right now we're still around 1 in 600 people in Allegheny County with covid, but within a week we should be under 1 in 1000 - we're getting close to flipping from "there's almost certainly a contagious student or two at this school" to "maybe nobody here has it".

Allegheny County has finally joined PA in dropping out of CDC's (old) "high" transmission range. Cases continue to drop, with county Rt still at 0.71 - fantastic. That's back to a 10-day halving rate, so we could be into "moderate" by mid to late next week, behavior permitting.
PA-wide hospital census: Using 17108 med/surg beds - 282 less than last Wednesday. % covid patients continues steady drop. ICU capacity continues improving.

Allegheny County daily vaccines drop to 478 1st+2nd doses, 375 booster doses/day
(5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 67.2% (state data), 48.8% of those are boosted.

PA counties with full ICU beds:

Schuylkill (2 +covid patients in ICU)
Bradford (4)
Clearfield (4)

Pennsylvania reports 1252 new cases.
Hospitalizations are -64 to 1292.
ICUs are -22 to 230 (81% full).
7 day avg drops to 1401-1430 cases/day
Transmission risk: CDC Substantial

Today's results reflect 20470 new PCR test results https://t.co/2awZrR3gR4
